alert.note: Alert for Franklin (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 10 at 8:49PM EDT until July 11 at 8:30AM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Massachusetts... West Deerfield River AT West Deerfield affecting Franklin County. For the Deerfield River...including West Deerfield...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...West Deerfield River at West Deerfield. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Portions of Stillwater Rd near I-91, Pogues Hole Rd, Round Pond Rd and Broughams Pond Rd are inundated. Floodwaters encroach on Little Meadow Rd. Also lowest lying recreational fields and some adjacent parking lots close to the Deerfield River are inundated. Flooding occurs along farmland and some farm houses close to the Deerfield River. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:31 PM EDT Monday the stage was 8.4 feet. - Bankfull stage is 25.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this evening to a crest of 11.0 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.9 feet on 10/20/1989. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Tuesday morning at 830 AM EDT.
